newsitem.title: FINLAND: FINNISH HOUSEHOLDS' MARKKA LOAN STOCK UP AGAIN NOV.
newsitem.headline: FINNISH HOUSEHOLDS' MARKKA LOAN STOCK UP AGAIN NOV.

text.p: The stock of markka credits granted by Finnish banks to households grew in November for the sixth straight month, while the average rate of interest on new markka loans to households and on the credit stock fell further, the Bank of Finland said in a review on Tuesday.

The stock of markka credits to households rose to 153.61 billion markka by end-November from 153.46 billion a month earlier. The average interest rate on the stock fell to 6.57 percent from 6.63 percent.
Banks granted 3.52 billion markka worth of new credits in November at an average interest rate of 6.19 percent.
In October, new markka credits to households totalled 4.05 billion markka and the average interest rate was 6.20 percent.

New markka credits granted by banks to the corporate sector rose to 2.82 billion markka in November from 2.24 billion in October. The average rate of interest on new corporate credits fell to 4.83 percent from 5.13 percent.

The stock of banks' markka credits to the corporate sector fell to 82.38 billion markka from 82.46 billion a month earlier while the average interest rate on the credit stock was unchanged at 5.25 percent, the Bank of Finland said.
